p: Drying is considered the crucial step in postharvest processes due to its importance in limiting enzymatic degradation and microbial growth while preserving the plant’s beneficial properties (Yuan et al. 2015). Traditionally, shade drying, sun drying and hot air drying are the standard preparation methods of C. morifolium. However, sulphur fumigation (SF), a fast and cheap method well known for its various benefits, including its ability to shorten drying time; preserve colour; and prevent pests, mould and bacterial contamination, has been commonly employed to replace the natural drying processes of C. morifolium in recent years (Kan et al. 2011).
